title: Drones hit glitzy Moscow buildings as Ukraine says Russians should feel war
description: Moscow-City, a complex of skyscrapers in the Russian capital, has become a repeat target as senior Ukrainian officials warn Russians to expect more attacks.

title: Border arrests surged in July, a blow to Biden migration plan
description: A 30 percent increase in Border Patrol arrests in July sets back a Biden administration already dealing with a judge’s rejection of its latest asylum policy.

title: Europeans start Niger evacuation amid coup as U.S. urges diplomacy
description: The White House, while urging Americans in Niger to avoid ‘unnecessary movements,’ said it had no indications of direct threats to U.S. citizens there.

title: When every day somewhere is a climate record of some sort
description: July was the world's hottest month. This may also be one of the coolest summers you will experience for the rest of your life.

title: Warner Bros. got in on Barbenheimer memes. It was no joke in Japan.
description: Warner Bros. Japan apologized after an official “Barbie” account engaged with art that linked the film with “Oppenheimer” and joked about nuclear explosions.

title: UNESCO wants to add Venice to list of endangered heritage sites
description: UNESCO's proposal is the latest alarm bell over the future of Venice — one of the world’s most fragile and popular cities – and Italy's efforts to protect it.

title: Church abuse hangs over Pope Francis’s Youth Day trip to Portugal
description: The Portuguese church tried to clean house on abuse before the pope's arrival. Its record got murkier.

title: Zoo denies rumors that its bear is a human in disguise
description: China’s latest internet sensation is Angela, a sun bear at Hangzhou Zoo who made a splash in a viral video by standing on her hind legs and "waving" to visitors.

title: After massive Hungarian passport fraud, U.S. tightens travel restrictions
description: The move comes against the backdrop of an increasingly fractious relationship between Hungary and the United States.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Skyscraper struck again after more drones swarm Moscow, mayor says
description: Russian air defenses shot down several drones in the capital. Ukraine has not claimed responsibility, but its armed forces shared video of damage in Moscow.

title: First the rain, then the mud: Typhoon wreaks havoc in Chinese capital
description: The military has been airdropping food to residents in the Mentougou district in western Beijing, which has been hit especially hard by record levels of rain.

title: For these young soldiers, Ukraine has been at war for half their lives
description: They were children when Russia invaded Crimea in 2014. Now, these teenage drone operators spend their days glued to their screens, fighting for their country’s survival.

title: Real estate agent fined over $15,000 for drinking milk at seller’s home
description: Mike Rose was fined 20,000 Canadian dollars after a home video camera caught the real estate agent drinking milk from a carton and putting it back in the fridge.

title: The coup in Niger puts spotlight on nation’s uranium
description: Niger is one of the main exporters of uranium to Europe. Amid escalating anti-French rhetoric after the coup, the junta announced it was suspending exports of uranium to France.
